A lot of the reviews are upset because it's not your typical highlighter, which I agree with, but I actually prefer something like this for my fair skin to a strobe-y highlighter. You also get a lot of product for the price. I have been using this under my MILK skin tint every day and I love the way my face looks. One thing I would mention is that the product is pretty sparkly, so that's why I use it under my makeup, because it still shines through the perfect amount.
reviews.review_title: Gives a great glowy look under foundation

reviews.review_text: I dont usually write many reviews so the fact that I'm writing one means I feel strongly about the product!! This gel highlighter is amazing! Gives me the hydrated dewy-glowy look without all the glitter,  a subtle natural shine, glow from within feel and look. So lightweight and comfortable to have on for hours in a day. Does not aggravate my sensitive/acne-prone skin. For my normal day to day I wear a natural light makeup look, and this is definitely now a mainstay in my product lineup. If that's the kind of look you also wear, i STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS! Love to support Saie ethos as well. xo!
reviews.review_title: amazing hydrated glowy look without the glitter!!

reviews.review_text: A tiny bit goes a really long way because it’s very runny, if you’re looking for a more natural highlighter that just makes you look like you’re a hydrated goddess, this is it.

I am sharing my honest and authentic opinion, as a Sephora Beauty Insider Community Ambassador. Eventually, I started liking this highlighter. When I first tried this, my skin was irritated and dry. At the time, I blamed it on the highlighter when it was mixed into my sunscreen. Now that I have used it on healthier skin,  I like it as an overall highlighter. I paired this with Biossance SPF 30, and instead of a slight white cast when I applied too much SPF, it made me look glowy. I like the fact that I don't have to try too hard or need a brush. It's a quick application with my fingers before my sunscreen. However, it does not work as a highlighter on my oily eyelids. It looks like a milky tear drop when I apply in the inner corner. It works great on the bridge of my nose. For the 1st time I get to see an elongation of nose!  I am not sure if I were to repurchase this, but it was a lovely product to try out. Thanks TeamBIC! Pic shown to compare noses :) .
Make my face feel sticky and congested, with a barely noticeable effect. I'll be returning this.

I really love this highlighter it sheared out on it’s on well. It also mixed well with my moisturizer and foundation. I loved it on my shoulders , legs and high points of face. Would love to try out the bronze color for summer. My skin tone is Nic 35-40 I prefer it mixed with moisturizer otherwise it can be too ashy on my skin tone.
Listen, I like a subtle dewy glow but this is the product equivalent of the Dua Lipa "go girl give us nothing" meme.
reviews.review_title: better, cheaper options at the drugstore

reviews.review_text: It is so unbelievably difficult to find makeup that doesn’t have silicone or bismuth oxychloride which causes cystic acne for people and I’m so happy I found this highlighter. I use it under my foundation to add a glow and it’s stunning. It feels lightweight going on and provides an unbelievable glow. I will say I’ve tried both shades and starglow is far more glowy and illuminating than the bronze shade. The only negative about it for me is the scent, it’s a strange offensive floral almost like dandelions or something but like most products the scent isn’t noticeable for long and dealing with the scent for great ingredients is fine with me

This is hydrating and that is about it. I do not trust any of the other reviews here as I was truly hopeful it would give me a fresh, dewy look with my makeup and it barely provided that. There was no sparkle, no dew, no nothing. It was as if I had simply moisturized my face with any plain old moisturizer. I really am so disappointed.

I never write reviews but I had to on this—the smell is so rotten and moldy and lingers. It even made my hands smell. I really wanted to like this. I really question the wisdom of taking out proven preservatives and replacing them with substitutes. So many clean brands get mold problems because of this, it’s not worth it.

I love this. I mix it with sunscreen and it looks great. For me this is perfect, however I’m light toned and use color Sunglow. It’s hard to see how this would work for someone with a darker skin tone.

Not dewy, not glowy and not a highlighter in my opinion. Maybe if you have baby butt smooth skin then yea but other than that no. This was more like a subtle lightweight bronzer and not what I was going for. I do love the scent though and typically I do not like scented stuff on my sensitive face but it smells like red cashew fruit from Guyana and it didn’t break me out. I didn’t buy it for the scent though so returned

I wanted to love this product, but unfortunately it did not live up to the hype. It's not dewy at all, its more shimmery. Not sure about the lighter tint but this one pills and leaves dark bits down my neck and around my face. Save your money and get the Milani - Glow Drops Radiance Boosting Serum instead.

I really like this! I honestly didn’t think I was gonna like anything from this brand bc eventhough they have glowing website reviews, youtubers have had a different experience. So I first got starglow as a free sample and it was...ok. Pretty underwhelming. It’s like if you took Charlotte tilbury flawless filter...and watered it completely down to barely any glow, and no dewy finish. 
However, I’m a fan of drunk elephants dibronzi drops for summer, but sometimes the finish is a little oily for me..so I thought I’d take a long shot and try the sunglow color in this as a more natural/satin finish version of dibronzi. And I’m actually impressed! It has a very similar shade (browned bronze - not too copper or orange) but much sheerer and dries down more. I think i might stick with this one instead of the drunk elephant. 

So pale girls looking for a little all over summer glow without looking too dewy or oily - try this! It made my skin look super healthy and radiant without being an oil slick!

I usually just wear this with sunblock. if I want to be fancy I'll wear it under a tinted moisterizer with some contouring (works great with the rest of my products).  I have normal to dry skin and I love the way it leaves my skin hydrated, plus a natural glowing skin. just an easy step to add to any routine that leaves great results. I recommend this product and will be purchasing when I run out. 

love that you can remove the sac inside the product so you can recycle without a mess.

Underwhelming.  This product is very lightweight and didn't irritate my skin, but the advertised "dewy glow" is very subtle.  I applied this after my skincare, and it managed to take away whatever natural dewiness my face had leftover from my skincare routine, and make my skin look duller.  No thanks.

This smells wonderful and feels nourishing. It adds a glow to my face. I wear it alone or sometimes under foundation. I think the only downside is that if I use with the saie skin tint it’s a little too dewy, like wet

Super lightweight gel that gives me the perfect glass skin glow when used as a primer. Works great with my acne-prone oily skin and doesn’t make me look greasy. It’s glowy without being sparkly. It’s similar to the rare beauty primer, so if you already have that it might be redundant to purchase this product, but when compared side by side, the SAIE is more natural, whereas the rare beauty has a silvery reflect. This paired with the glow drops by glow recipe is just *chef’s kiss*

Beautiful!! It’s so easy to apply and adds just the right amount of glow. I put it on my cheek bones and have received so many compliments on how healthy my skin looks! It’s subtle and natural looking—must have!

Love, love, love!  This feels great on your skin and gives a healthy glow. I can wear this with or without foundation and it looks great either way. The Starglow color is sheer with not a lot of tint to it. I plan on getting the bronze color as well for days when I want a little more color. Highly recommend this for the warmer months.
I don't understand the hype.. this smells rosy and nice but makes me look oily and shiny, but not in a shimmery or good way. Not sure what the point of this is.

I received a sample of this and bought the full sized immediately! It’s just stunning! Such a lit from within look and the perfect light weight! Only thing to be careful of is the large size would be too big for travel!
Purchased a few different Saie product and love them all. It’s been a nice extra layer for when my skin feels a bit dull.

it’s a very pretty highlight but once blended into the skin it completely disappears. I naturally have oily skin I did a comparison and one side of my face and couldn’t tell the difference because it is very subtle and blends into it the skin.

Such a natural dewy skin finish!!! I put this on my cheekbones, under my brows and in the inner corners of my eyes! I always get so many compliments when I wear this!! I can’t wait to wear this more in the summer!!!!!

Coincidently was sent one my my favorite products to try! I started using this back in July 2020 and it has been a staple ever since. I like to mix with my Kosas foundation .. it goes on super smooth and leaves you with a subtle glow. Can't wait to try more Saie products!

Absolutely love this product! It definitely gives a nice glowy look to the skin without being a highlighter. The only thing that I don’t like but isn’t worth my knocking off a star, is the smell. It doesn’t smell the worst but not the best either, it’s something I can overlook though as it only lasts a few seconds during applying it to my skin. I’ll be purchasing the bronze one to try out which I’m excited for!
This product amazing it fits itself seamlessly with every product I overlapped with I love the glitter so soft!!! GLOWING I WOKE UP LIKE THIS!!!!!

I have been using this product daily for over a month and I am really enjoying it. If I could change anything it would only be its smell - quite strong for me. It looks beautiful as a highlighter when I don't wear foundation (as it can move foundation underneath). Mixed with foundation or moisturizer is a dream too. But as a primer is what I enjoy the best. It has a blurring effect on my pores which I never got from an illuminating primer before. Anything I put on top looks much better. I want to try the bronze shade now and see how it compares to my beloved Drunk Elephant D-bronzi. It comes in recyclable packaging which is great! The company also accepts empty products for recycling which is awesome and I hope more and more companies start doing so!

I received this product as a sample and have made it a staple in my routine. I mix a few pumps with a little tinted moisturizer and my skin is glowing. It works well for those light makeup days when you only need a little coverage. Definitely purchasing the full size

Love this stuff! but to be honest, I never would have bought it because I don't use highlighters. However, I got this for free to review and so happy I did! I don't normally wear foundation so I mix this in with my moisturizer serum and apply all over my face then wear a light setting powder. It truly gives a lit from within glow, makes my face look bright and healthy but not greasy or sparkly. Now I know it says it's made of 75% water, but the skincare ingredients they've added (vit c, rosehip oil, etc) actually really help keep my skin happy, smooth and hydrated all day! I've been wearing this for weeks now and have had zero breakouts or irritation. I consider this as much a skincare step as a makeup step, and wow the price is great, I will definitely be repurchasing. The pump is a little finicky as others have mentioned, and I haven't worn it just on its own or mixed with foundation, but for me, mixed with my moisturizer it works great.
reviews.review_title: Lovely! Skincare and makeup in one

reviews.review_text: This is such a cool product, I love how this company has incorporated skin care with makeup. This leaves such a beautiful glow on the skin and it is not heavy or greasy. It mixes well with foundation or can be layered underneath, or you can just use it on its own for a beautiful dewy look. It's not shimmery or glittery it just leaves this beautiful finish that leaves the skin looking hydrated and healthy with a lit from within glow. I love the ingredients and I'm so happy to find a product like this that is lightweight, especially with face masks.

Love this stuff. I mix with my Elta MD sunscreen and it gives me a great glow on make up and no makeup days. I have fair skin and don’t feel like the Sunglow color is too dark. Honestly don’t notice much color change at all. 10/10 recommend.
Beautiful glow but If  you go out in the sun and look in a mirror (I noticed in my car mirror) you face will sparkle like Edward Cullen.

I love this product! It’s beautiful and pearlescent. Gorgeous glow on the skin and mixed it foundation it’s perfect. I also put it on my shoulders and chest. Has a rosey floral scent, but it doesn’t bother me and I am sensitive to smells. Lightweight and amazing. Glad I have it for spring/summer.

The package says lightweight highlighter but in my opinion it’s great when applied to whole face. It’s very lightweight and has very subtle shine. I used it under my full coverage foundation and it made my foundation look so much better and natural looking. I believe it can also double as a primer too as I used it directly over my moisturized face and then applied foundation over it. It does have noticeable fragrance but it did not annoy me. 
I don’t think I could make it work as just “highlighter” (on cheekbones, nose bridge, etc.) as it’s very fluid and very very light intensity. I really like this product as it makes my dull complexion look alive.

So glowy! I mix this with my Supergoop Unseen Sunscreen and it gives me such a beautiful bronzed look without the texture of using a bronzer. Can wear this with just a touch of concealer for a more natural day look

I was lucky to receive this product as a gratis from Sephora TeamBIC to test for review. I am mid 30s with sensitive-ish and dry-ish skin.

This is an AMAZING product. I definitely would not have picked up on my own, but I am so happy I got to test this, because it is a new holy grail. For me, this product has three purposes: 1. As a dewy, all over base product. This is my least favorite way to use, but it does provide a nice layer of dew and shimmer (if using a light coverage on top). 2. As a highlight. It is lovely, easy to smooth and apply, and is super natural in terms of shade, not icy at all. It does not pick up any of the makeup underneath. It applies well with both a finger and synthetic brush. For both, it is super impactful in the sun. 3. My favorite way to use it is to mix it in with difficult to work foundations. I use it by mixing it with non oil based foundations that are too dry or too thick, and it just makes them so much easier to apply, while also sheering out coverage just a tiny bit. It has made my panning of difficult foundations so much easier. I already want a back up.
This picture was taken 8+ hours after application. My skin is naturally oily yet this product doesn’t ever look bad! Beautiful and subtle. I mix it with my spf every day.

I wish this product didn't have oil in it. I tend to stay away from oil in my morning skincare and daytime makeup because it makes me photosensitive. This has rosehip oil in it, which contains vitamin A, which makes you photosensitive.

Beautiful, dewey lightweight highlighter gives you that underlying glow that shines through your makeup without interfering with it. I used this product all over my face under my makeup, but you can also mix it with your foundation! It has a 75% water content that allows for combining it with foundation or even concealer. Love it! Light floral scent is not overpowering. I have more on this product on my YouTube channel @beyondshadow2020

I bought this on a whim because I like looking glowy but don’t always want a full face of makeup. I bought the sunglow color because I’m a medium-deep skin tone, a bit darker than the model for this color. I put it over my sunscreen and it looks beautiful like a glow from within. For my sisters and other melanated friends, this is a good product. I took a star off because I’m not a fan of the fragrance. It might be irritating to some.
This dewy highlighter is really beautiful. Especially on mature skin. The only issue I noticed is that is tends to peel and cake when set with powder. It works best when just left alone on the skin.
This gel highlighter is light on your skin and dries fairly quick. You really only need a small amount if you use daily so the huge bottle will last you forever. Overall really nice!
It would look great on lighter skin tones but not dark skin. I put three layers and it’s like it melted into my foundation.

I’ve been dying to try this brand for a while and then it came to Sephora, so naturally I took advantage of the free sample they had. I absolutely adore the natural glow this gives. I’ve seen negative reviews of this saying it doesn’t show up, but there’s definitely a decent amount of sparkle in this that catches the light. Not too greasy and not too glittery, it’s a perfect medium. I love liquid/creme/oil highlighters and compared to something like the glossier futuredew or haloscope, I have to say I prefer this. This dries down and doesn’t leave you feeling sticky like the other 2 products I mentioned.
lovely highlighter. almost no shimmer in it, just a light luminous finish that’s flattering for day and night wear. it’s very subtle so I would recommend for mature skin too!

I received starglow as a sample to try out and definitely agree this WILL NOT work as a highlighter on its own! it looks as though I put zero product on when I swatch it. definitely shouldn’t waste your money

I was pleasantly surprised by this highlighter. For how it came out of the bottle (see photo for reference) I thought it would apply super messy. However, it blended in nicely, though having a proper brush is key (I used a fan brush). Now, this is a very LITE highlight. You will not shine like the sun with this, the color is very subtle. Even as I tried to build it up, I couldn't get much more shine and it ended up looking greas the more I added on. Also, a lot comes out of the pump. You really need only a couple drops to get a nice highlight, but the pump makes far more than you need come out. However, if you enjoy a lite highlight, this is a good product and you definitely get a lot of product for your dollar.

As a highlighter this product doesn’t work for me. It doesn’t work well with any of my foundations and the pigments is streaky and heavy. However it is an absolutely great illuminating primer. The bottle is huge for a highlighting product, but will last nicely as a illuminating primer. I like the scent because it has a pleasant natural freshness.
reviews.review_title: An illuminating primer not a highlighter

reviews.review_text: I've been using it as a primer before I apply my foundation and it gives me a great dewy finish. It's subtle and smells like rose water which I really enjoy.
I really enjoy this it isn’t a must have but nice to have in my collection feels good on my skin not sticky. It’s not chunky glitter it is a natural dew look

I would like to say that I purchased this on my own, based on all of the great reviews. Yeah I don’t get it. Yes, it’s a pretty Highlighter, but if you put it over your foundation it totally removes the foundation. It ruined my makeup look and I had to re-do it. There are so many other beautiful highlights out there that don’t do this. Sad.

If you are sensitive to smell or do not like perfume scented products I would avoid this highlighter. The good thing about this product is it’s versatility and how a little pump goes a long way. You can apply it as a liquid highlighter on the high points of the face on top or under foundation. I like applying it with my fingers to my forehead and cheekbones over my foundation for that extra glow from within. You can also add a little pump and mix it into your foundation to give you a nice glowy look.

I received a sample and besides the horrible smell, i
Swear it just disappeared on my skin.. I like everything else I’ve tried from this brand. But this was so bad that I almost thought I was doing something wrong somehow. The picture is exactly where I put the highlighter (more than one layer) I do not recommend.

It does make a gorgeous natural highlighter, but I really like a more glow than a dew for my highlight. I personally love using it with skincare before the rest of my makeup for a luminous brightening effect, as well as on its own for a natural, hydrated look. It is weightless as all get out! I personally don’t mind my texture and it’s just so pretty on its own! To use as a highlighter, I place it on the back of my hand and blend it out a little before putting it on top of foundation to rid some of the water, I found fingertips and sponges help more than a brush!

I received this product for free from Sephora in exchange for an honest review. 

This is a nice luminating highlighter that leaves the skin with a natural glow that doesn't look oily or glittery. I've tried this mixed into several matte foundations and like the light glow that it gives to my face. It looks natural and lasts for several hours. You don't need much of the highlighting liquid to get the effect.
reviews.review_title: A little goes a long way

reviews.review_text: This product does exactly what it says it will do.  Super lightweight, provides a dewy shimmer.  I've added it to my tinted serum for a glowy coverage.  That said - I cannot stand the scent which is a very floral rose.  I have sensitive skin and really don't understand putting fragrance in a facial product. I like what the product does, but won't purchase.

I wasn’t sure what to expect from this product because I have allergies to fragrances and chemicals but this highlighter is great, the fragrance is very light and fresh. I definitely can tell it’s pure & clean, it actually feels nourishing, which I have never found in any other makeup product.

This is ideal for me as a highlighter because unlike a powder product, it doesn't highlight texture or look too blingy. It's just a soft, dewy glow that melts into the skin. I have no problem applying it over foundation or blush.
So smooth and such nice color. I find it I can apply on cheeks for that peak of glow. Good clean ingredients so I did not react will be using while dry season

I loveeee this product. I just put on my foundation, cream blush and then lightly pat/swirl this on my cheekbones and this truly gives that “glass skin” appearance, which I love. It isn’t really shimmery or glittery but gives more of a smooth dewy look, very subtle and natural but beautiful. If you love the glass skin look that you get after putting on a moisturizer, this will be perfect for you! Also huge plus that it’s a Clean at Sephora product.

I forgot to bring my primer when I went to go get ready at a friend’s house. I figured I’d try this under my foundation since we weren’t going anywhere important and I just needed something with a slight grip. I was so surprised at how my foundation came out with this as a primer. My skin looked so smooth and had a light glow to it (I used UD Stay Naked foundation, which has a medium coverage, so some of this highlighter was peaking through). My makeup stayed intact throughout the whole day, even in my t zone and upper lip area, which is where my makeup usually breaks down. Hands down I would buy this again.

I LOVE THIS! I was surprised by this product at first. I thought it was a highlighter, but it is actually a dewy highlighting fluid that makes your skin appear lit from within. I am a fan of MAC’s Strobe Cream as I use it for this same purpose, but restrict it to my cheeks. This can be used all over your face for that fresh, dewy look. You only need a bit, so it will last forever. The formulation is very light since it’s more than 75% water, so it won’t clog your pores or cause breakouts. It also makes makeup you wear after adhere better. The key is that it looks completely natural and dewy, not glittery or artificial. Since it’s a clean product, it’s an added bonus to not have to worry about harmful ingredients and I love how Saie makes it super easy to recycle. I received this product for free, but I will most likely be purchasing it when it finishes! I’m wearing it in this photo with no foundation.

Bought this straight from their site, I was hoping this would be a dupe to the discontinued becca pearl liquid highlighter but it was such a disappointment, the shipper sits on your skin so patchy with or without makeup and underneath makeup it does not look natural at all!

This is okay if you like more of a balm and want a VERY subtle almost oily look. I’ve never once taken stars off or reviewed a product based on its scent so harshly as this one though, folks. Oooof she stinks. The smell is god awful and I don’t have “sensitive nose.”

For the price, the performance is an okay way to add a hint of sheen and dewiness to your skin. it would be good for mature skin that does not want as dramatic an effect as the similar Becca liquid highlight.  I could only see the effect in direct sunlight (that photo would not upload), but attached a photo in normal daylight of the product rubbed into my hand.

It is a very subtly moisturizing product that will add a touch of dewiness to dry skin, but may be completely missed on oily skin or nornalnskin that's been moisturized where other highlighting products could easily eclipse the effect.  For me, this subtle effect is desirable, knowing it won't be overdone.  For those looking for a notable sheen, they may be disappointed.  

I was provided this product at no cost for my honest review.
This is my new holy grail! It is so dewy and pretty. I am in love!! I always try and use clean at Sephora products, and it is great to incorporate this into my makeup routine. Must have!

Received this free for a review. First of all, the packaging is gorgeous! Frosted heavy glass, simple design, looks so good! Then I adored the ingredients inside, this product not only decorates you but also takes care about your skin in long term. Finally, the highlight effect is luxurious, soft enough to use on your whole face under your foundation for boosting the overall glow of your skin, and delicate enough to accent your cheekbones as a final step of your make up. I used both ways though prefer for the whole face because of its benefits for skin's health. But I take one star away for because of the smell. It is not strong but is very unpleasant for me. I could not use it for more than a week so much I could not tolerate the smell. So, make sure you try it first before committing to buy, you might like or not its scent. I regretfully cannot use it, will try again later, may be something will change. Got it for free for a review.
great product! gives you a nice dewy glow without making you too shiny. lovely!

This does nothing.. all hype, what
Am I supposed to do with this. Colorless odorless ineffective

I started using this before it came to Sephora, it’s incredible!! It gives a gorgeous dewy glow and it doesn’t accentuate pores, it actually hides them.  Gel makes it sound like it isn’t moisturizing but it is... and you can mix it with foundation , even body lotion for chest and shoulders or wear it alone for a quick fix.  It’s really so beautiful and I’m so happy Sephora carries this line...
reviews.review_title: Beautiful Glowy highlighter but so much more

reviews.review_text:
Correcting my previous review as I didn't select the correct product. I bought the Starglow - universal champagne highlighter. 

This is a very light application unless you dab it multiple times. I like to mix it with my foundation and it's perfect for that. It has a light scent that is pleasant and not overpowering. The packaging is beautiful. This is my first time trying this brand.
reviews.review_title: Lovely glow, light scent - I like it!

reviews.review_text: This is a very light application unless you dab it multiple times. I like to mix it with my foundation and it's perfect for that. It has a light scent that is pleasant and not overpowering. The packaging is beautiful. This is my first time trying this brand.
reviews.review_title: Lovely glow, light scent - I like it!

reviews.review_text: Don’t waste your time and money on any other skin glow or highlighter this is affordable for the amount and worth every penny even if oily or dry! Get this

This highlighter is smooth, creamy, lightweight and not glittery or greasy. It has a rosy, maybe slightly plastic-y scent, but rose is what stood out the most to me - it was light though, and I could really only smell it while I was applying it.
I love that this can be used so many different ways! I've used it underneath foundation, mixed in with foundation, on top of moisturizer and mixed in with moisturizer - all methods worked well and gave my dry skin a nice dewy, luminous, refreshed look.  There is a sort of pearly sheen to it, along with some micro sparkles that I mostly notice when I use it alone or on top of skincare, and in good/direct light. The swatches shown are under direct sunlight. 
Docked one star because of the scent.

I have dry skin, so anything that claims to help me glow is a must try! You can use it it many different ways, but my favorites are either mixed in with my medium/full coverage foundation or used underneath my light/medium foundation. I have tried to use this by itself with no foundation on top, but I discovered it was too dewy of a look for me. In my swatches below, I have it built up on top and sheered out on the bottom. The price point for the performance of this product is amazing!

Products like this are not my cup of tea. I have nice glossy skin on its own.
I wanted to give it a try because it was sent by Sephora for reviewing purposes. I couldn't get over the scent, it reeks to me and my sensitive nose couldn't handle it.
However, I put it on my face and I wasn't very happy about it. It's very sticky, not too shiny and it looks like my usually oily skin after work. I don't like this effect and this product.
**PR by Sephora for reviewing purposes.

This is not a traditional liquid highlighter. It’s more of a universal product that you can mix with your favourite foundation or moisturizer for an all over dewy glow; wear it alone for a glass skin look; apply with a sponge or your fingertips as a highlighter - however there is no shimmer or glitter. It’s truly a radiant glow. 4 stars only because I think a lot of product comes out when you pump and it’s a bit wasteful (for me).

This reminds me of LXMI’s goddess glow but it has more of a water like consistency and is a cool tone (star glow). It blends easily and gives a dewy glow over make up. Without make up it has a subtle shimmer. The nice thing about this product is that it spreads evenly so it looks natural and shimmery. It’s not sticky either.

This is not just a Highlighter. This is a punch of glow in this bottle. This product give the most incredible dewy sheen to the skin . No chunky glitter just a beautiful and most natural glow. So weightless, it can be used on its own or layered with your skincare, primer or foundation for an added boost. The formula is so easy to mix with other makeup products. It is the most silkiest and softest Highlighter I have tried. I also noticed if you apply it with a fluffy brush it will give you subtle glow and if applied with flat brush it will give you serious red carpet shine.
Ladies, if you are looking for a highlighter you can just sweep on before zoom meetings or some spontaneous date night plans, make it this one. 
(PS -The picture I am posting is the one with just Super Gel Highlighter after my morning 7 step skin care routine. Every step is crucial and has its benefit). 
This highlighter is to die for. I have always used YSL highlighter which are expensive. But this on the other hand doesn’t break your bank account!! Super awesome.

Got this as a deluxe sample with purchase. When I tried it, it blended out into almost nothing. Maybe a very faint glow if I squinted. I prefer a bright glow so this was a mark against it for me, but if you only want something subtle this could be a good option for you. I’m also very fair so it might show up better on deeper skin tones.
LOVE THIS PRODUCT. Amazing results. I have oily/combination skin and it still worked great mixed in with my foundation. Love it!

I am loving this luminizer!!! It reminds me of Marc Jacobs Dew Drops! I apply it right after my primer for a really glowy base and I've also used a touch of it as a liquid highlighter.  This summer, I also plan to mix it with my foundation!  It's a super versatile product! 

*Gifted by Sephora

Pros: 
glass bottle / recyclable packaging
Clean beauty product
You get a lot of product for the price

I tried this product under my makeup and mixed in to my moisturizer. I just didn't notice that it did much. I wish I would have received the product in the sunglow shade as I use Drunk Elephant dbronzi everyday to get a bronzed glow. I may purchase it in sunglow to replace my dbronzi as its a way better value. 

I do like this product used under my eyes and in the inner curves to highlight this area before I apply concealer.
This is a total gem. I use this mixed with my foundation and love it so much. It’s very subtle and I think the glowy particles are really tiny. But the end effect is just ethereal.

I was gifted this product from sephora and think it's a great highlighter... Although I'm not a big fan of liquid highlighters, this is great for those who want that glowy dewy look. I'm more of a powder person to be honest, I think the size and price for this is amazing. But it's just not my cup of tea.

This product was sent to be by Sephora, however my review is 100% honest and truthful. This product has become such a staple in my makeup routine. It provides such a gorgeous glow under or over my makeup. The way I have been using it is as a base, under my foundation for a dewy-er finish. I also find when I use it under my foundation, it helps make my foundation last longer. On days where I wear lighter/no makeup I mix it in with my moisturizer for a healthier glow. I love this so much and plan on repurchasing when I run out. I think this will look gorgeous in the summer.

I mixed Starglow with my foundation and wow I was not expecting this instant dewy complexion! With the dry winter season, I’ve been used to seeing my skin dry/flaky so this was a very welcomed change. It maintained the dewiness throughout the day too. It’s interesting to note that when I swatched the illuminator on my arm, in daylight it looks like a pearlescent film, but once brought into sunlight, you can really see the super fine sparkles. The sparkles weren’t noticeable on the face with the foundation mix, but rather translated into a smooth look. For my second try-on, I wore Starglow mixed with my foundation only on half of my face and just foundation on the other half to see if I could make out the difference. Starglow is applied on the right side of the photo attached (side with my beauty mark) and there’s a a bit more radiance on that side, particularly on the cheek. This also has a pleasant scent that I’m guessing is either the Papaya Seed Oil or Rosa Canina Fruit Oil, since it doesn’t smell like Rosehip oil to me. The finished result reminds me of the Josie illuminator (see swatches attached), although Starglow has more of a primer-like feeling, which I like. I’m trying to shorten this review, but I just can’t stop saying good things about this Starglow highlighter!

I love this highlighter since it’s so glowy and dewy due to the very fine micro pearls. I would give this a 5 stars but for some reason the fragrance is off putting, my boyfriend smelled it and he said it reminded him of a wet towel that’s been left out in the sun. I really wish the fragrance was more refreshing or no fragrance at all .

A liquid highlighter with an excellent clean ingredients. It does not contain large glitters and a very bright glow. This gives a beautiful light natural glow, as if the skin is well hydrated. I mix this with a foundation and use it on my face, or with a body moisturizer and use it on my hands, collarbones and legs. It looks very natural and the skin is well-groomed. The highlighter is slightly sticky if not mixed with cream and foundation. After using the highlighter, I noticed that my skin more hydrated.
I think this will be my must have for the summer.

This is a very subtle highlight. I liked it best when I used it on my bare face. Unfortunately I tried to mix it in my foundation and I find that it caused my foundation to separate. I will try it next mixed with my moisturizer. I tried to wear it over my foundation but found that it did fade after a couple of hours. I received this product in a gratis package in exchange for an honest review .

I don't usually use highlighter-type products so I wasn't expecting to use this much, but I actually really, really like it! It's kind of a water-serum texture, and gives a nice subtle glow - not glittery and not really shimmery, but...dewy. 

At first I applied it in a few areas over the Slip Tint. I like the look, but it takes a little longer than the Slip Tint to sink in/dry. 

Now, I actually mix it directly in with Slip Tint and use both together. Again, I'm usually not into a dewy finish but I really, really like the way this looks. It's not sticky or oily in the least.
This product is beautiful. It’s so incredibly easy to work with and creates a beautiful glow. I love how easy it is to mix in with my foundations, and it gives such a gorgeous glow to any product!
When the sun hits it's a glitter explosion on your face.

Writing an honest review in exchange for the product. Was super excited to try this gel, i wanted the shade in sunglow for a more sunkissed look, but received starglow. More of a miscommunication issue than a product one. It is a very night subtle highlight, however i do feel the color isn’t complimentary on me and sunglow would have been perfect. It’s more of a pearlescent shine than a glitter highlight though, which is great. definitely useful for those who prefer a natural dewy makeup routine. Also useful on the body to get a more texturized/shiny look.

I really enjoy this gel highlighter. I mix it with my foundation and it gives my face a beautiful natural glow. I was worried it would look bad on me because i have oily combination skin but it just looked so beautiful on my face. It's not sticky, lasts a long time and a little goes a long way. I sometimes apply it just on my cheeks as a regular highlighter.

I received this product for free from Sephora in exchange for an honest review. I was pretty excited about this product because of the multiple applications it has. I do love that the formula is hydrating and gives a glowy look without looking shimmery or glittery. Unfortunately, I felt like it really accentuated my pores and texture anywhere on my face where it was applied. I won’t use it as a primer or for an all over glow, but it is really pretty for me as a body highlighter for a night out. It also seems like a good value for the price and the packaging feels more luxurious than the price point would indicate.

I didn't expect to like this having heard reviews of some of their other products but I actually do. My skin tint is already a little dewy so I use this as a selective highlighter as opposed to mixing it into my skin tint/foundation, and you only need a little when used like this. the formula is almost like a water-based serum. it's not glittery but gives a lovely glow. it reminds me a little of my Daniel Sandler watercolor highlighter. I love that they went the extra to make this as recyclable and eco-friendly as possible. and you get a buttload of product.

I just got this last week and I LOVE it!!  I’ve been mixing it with my mineral-based sunscreen to add a dewy, bronzy glow.  I’ve also put it on my bare face and thought it would be super dark at first, but it is actually slightly sheer.  The formula is like a creamy gel, it’s not greasy at all and leaves the perfect glow!  I have a medium skin tone and the bronze color is perfect.  Perhaps go with the lighter color if you have fair/light skin though.

Was excited to see a new "clean" makeup brand. One of the makeup specialists raved about the texture and glow.  I tried it on my hand and liked the glow.  However, the musty,  Very funky smell is off putting.  I've seen too many "clean" brands have problems with molds to take a chance.

Ok so here is my usage log :)
Day 1 - I decided to try it with my lightweight foundation. I mixed them in and applied to my face. The result was very diluted. My already very lightweight foundation became even more sheer so I had to go with powder on top of my cheeks and forehead to get additional coverage. Then, I decided to enhance the highlighter effect and I applied just the Saie highlighter on my cheekbones on top. That didn't work as well because it smudged my foundation.

Day 2 - Decided to mix one pump with my medium/full coverage foundation. It was perfect! I was so happy I got the formula right. My matte full coverage foundation needed that highlighter mixed in. The result was a sheerer foundation with the lightest, most natural glow. I got a compliment on my skin that day.
The sparkle is milled so fine that it gives the most natural looking skin.

I would highly recommend this lightweight highlighter if you like a more natural glow. I personally prefer my highlighter to be hardly there.

Truly a lit-from-within-glow in a bottle, it’s like being candle lit. Adds subtle warmth and sheen to my super fair skin, without making me look like a disco ball. I’ve tried this both pre-foundation as well as mixed in foundation and it just makes my face look so luminous. Mixed with tinted moisturizer it is super dewy (which I love). Not sure how this would work for super oily folks, but for combo skin it doesn’t seem to turn me into a grease ball. Will def be a staple in my makeup collection from here on out.

I was excited to select this item as a sample. I wish I could say that I liked this product but could not get pass the smell.  The smell was so strong that it turned me off.  I only tried it on my hand but the glow was nice.  However, I simply can not get passed the smell and I’m not usually someone sensitive to fragrance.
reviews.review_title: Is it me or does this product have a smell?

reviews.review_text:
I received this as a free sample with checkout and I am surprisingly pleased! The Becca liquid highlight in opal had always been my go to but this product makes my skin look incredibly hydrated and plump. I tried this as a highlight over my Tower28 cream blush, and this combination is divine! 

You need the smallest amount, I will be purchasing this product once I finish my sample size.

I'm really happy with this. You'll see I posted two pictures below. The first is of me wearing my Huda Beauty #fauxfilter Foundation, Merit Mood blush, and Fenty Deep Neutrals eyeshadow. I'd ordinarily spray setting spray on afterward. Instead, in the second picture, I put the Saie Glowy Super Gel in Starglow over the makeup. I hope you can see the gorgeous dewy look it gave. I like both looks but I love the softness of the Starglow over everything. Sephora did send me this and the Merit blush to try for free. Other makeup: Lipstick is Pat McGrath MatteTrance in Executive Realness; Brows are Patrick Ta Tinted Major Brow Shaping Wax.

I really like this - I’ve mixed it with a variety of skin tints from Glossier, Ilia and Tart and was happy with how it blended in and looked on the skin. When worn alone it creates a pretty glow that lasts for hours. It didn’t pill or cause any issues with my makeup application or setting. It also felt like it helped keep my skin hydrated throughout the day.

I don't know what I did before this product. I actually started off buying the Saie marshmallow highlighter, but returned it for this and I am so happy I did! This product is so beautiful to put on before makeup, and it's amazing as a highlighter! It's a gel and very light on the skin. It has a honey smell when applied but it disappears after a few minutes. It makes my skin look very glowy in a natural way. I've been wearing it under a tiny amount of the Lys Serum Foundation and the combo is killer! I love how many new clean beauty brands are popping up at Sephora. I want to try more from this brand!
reviews.review_title: The best makeup base and highlighter

reviews.review_text:
The dispenser is not it. The pump is clumsy and messy, dispensing too much product with no control and spilling it all over itself. 
The product itself is pretty great, moisturizing and nourishing, gives a nice glow. I don’t find it mixes well with my foundations though.

This is such a beautiful product! It's like a boost of hydration for your skin with a slight added shimmer! 

It has a slight shimmer in it for sure (not glitter), so I have to admit, I would personally only use this as a dew/natural-ish highlight (since I don't wear face makeup). But I'm sure if you wear foundation and want that dewy look, you could mix it in with that! It feels really hydrating on the skin and has a slight scent that goes away pretty quickly upon application. 

The bottle is pretty large in my opinion, so I feel like it would last quite a long time!
Gives your skin a inner glow that everyone wants. Also a great primer before makeup or as just as a wet highlight on high points of your face. A must have product.

If you want a product that enhances your makeup than this is the product for you! Holy cow wasn’t expecting such a light yet beautiful dewy glow. I put the highlight on than my liquid foundation and it looked better than I’ve ever seen and without highlight!! I was blown away at how nice it accented my skin. Subtle yet totally enhances your look

The clean highlighter you've been looking for! It feels incredibly light like you're not wearing anything on. It's perfect for that light within glow by itself but I  also love combining with the kosas oil foundation. I  also love that the shimmer is so fine and subtle, you won't see giant sparkles on your face. You can wear it all over and it looks natural.

This is such a special product and can be used in so many ways... worn alone, underneath makeup, mixed in with foundation, or applied on top of makeup. In that sense this product is really cool and creative! The formula reminds me of a hybrid between Charlotte Tilbury’s Hollywood Flawless Filter and Glow Recipe’s Glow Drops, leaning much closer to the Glow Drops consistency. Glowy Super Gel has a very wet feeling on the skin. It has a much more watery consistency rather than oil or makeup consistency. Definitely gives water gel vibes. Now with that said, I find myself not reaching for this very often because it is too light/sheer and water gel dewy. It seems to water down my foundation too much for my liking. Wearing on top of makeup doesn’t really work for me either. I would consider using this on days I do not want to appear I am wearing makeup, but still want to add a little dew to my skin. I think I may like this product more in the summertime when I my skin is more tan. Overall I do like this product and will continue testing in my routine.

Wow! This stuff is gorgeous. It creates a FLAWLESS luminous complexion. Its not oily or greasy or overly shiny, it’s just a natural lit from within glow. I looovve that this is made up of 75% water. I like to use this on its on over moisturizer or primer but I’ve also tried it mixed into my moisturizer and foundation and either way is fabulous. It’s also great on no makeup days to help ur skin look more perfected and beautiful.
I love this highlighter! It looks very natural and gives a fresh, dewy glow. I use it on the high points of my face but could also be used mixed with a foundation for an all over glow.

I actually really, really like this. The gel base makes it instantly soothing and cooling when applied to the skin. I love that it can be worn so many different ways over makeup, under makeup, or mixed in makeup. It gives a beautiful luminous glow that passes for that glow from within we all want. It ends up being very lightweight and breathable. It has a very faint scent that dissipates pretty quick. I prefer wearing this under my makeup because I feel as though it last longer and looks more natural. I could see this being questionable as an all over glow if you have oily skin.

This product surprised me! I wasn’t expecting much, if any effect, but it really did give my skin a more dewy, glowy look. I have oily skin, so I was a bit worried that it might mess with my foundation formula (everything breaks down on my skin!) but it hold up fine and doesn’t give me an oily shine. 

If you’re like me, and use mattifying products out of necessity, but like a dewy look, it’s worth a try!

For reference, I am in my 40s, I have dry, textured, aging skin, and I have enlarged pores, dark spots and fine lines. I have it all... :(
I really like this product! You can use it also on your body and it leaves it hydrated and gorgeous!! 
PROS: *Not glittery. *Discreet natural glow, so if you want something intense, I don’t think this is it. *It can be used directly on your face for a gorgeous pearly glow or mixed with your foundation (as I do) for a natural healthy glow. *Clean ingredients. *Easy to recycle glass packaging. *Cruelty-free *It feels luxurious. *It feels hydrating on skin, which I specially appreciate with my dry skin. *It is not sticky or tacky. *Skincare ingredients included in the formula, perfect for my aging skin. *Good price for the quality and amount you get! 
CONS: *If you have texture (like I do) it may accentuate it. *If you mix it with a matte long lasting foundation, it will make your foundation lose the long lasting/non transfer quality! (at least it happened with my Too Faced Born This Way Matte foundation)

This one pleasantly surprised me. I was never used to be someone who uses highlighters on a regular base but I’m glad I gave this a try. It looks dark from the outside but it’s actually a light universal champagne color with subtle shimmers. It melts into the skin so easily and gives your complexion a subtle glow depending on how much you use. I’ve tried multiple ways to use this but my favorite way is to use it as a glowy primer that I rub all over my face before applying foundation. It leaves your skin with a nice sheen, and after foundation my face looks pretty dewy, not annoyingly shiny. I’ve tried to mix it directly with foundations as well and it works great, but I prefer to use it as a primer since I like simple steps. I think this is a strong player if you are into the dewy look or if you simply want to dab this on the high points of your cheek bones as a true highlighter. It should be flattering for all skin tones. See my photos for the color payoff.

This is a really beautiful highlighter/ all over glow. I first used this mixed with my moisturizer before work and found it was too much for me. I have dehydrated combo skin and it didn't look good, my forehead was way too shiny. I then decided to try it with my moisturizer when I went to bed. When I woke up it was still pretty glowy and looked better as time went on. It definitely stays put. Makes a really pretty highlighter on it's own, and over all skin glow. For me this will either be used just for cheeks or for when I want a nice glow the next day. I'm including two photos, the one with the eye, you can see it above the eye brow that is right after I applied it. The full face is 12+ hours after application. I did receive this as a gratis from Sephora for testing.

Glowy Super Gel Lightweight Dewy highlighter is an illuminating gel-based luminizer made of 75% of water that can be mixed with skincare, foundation or warn alone for fresh dewy look.

Ingredients:
Plant-Derived Glycerin
Vitamin C
Rose Hip Seed Oil

This product comes in recyclable packaging, cruelty free, clean beauty. 

My favorite way is to mix it with my foundation for glowy dewy look. I apply it as highlighter for sheer glow, it doesn’t disturb foundation or blush underneath. It can be used for the glow anywhere on the body collarbones, shoulders and legs. If you apply it on the bear face you’ll get glass skin look. I’ll get a good use of it in summer. I like that it’s not tacky at all, no shimmer, no texture. I also like apply it to my under eye area. It has blurring effect. Has subtle pleasant scent. Beautiful formula!

Very lightweight which gives a very very natural glow to highlight skin. It’s not oily and used it under a powder foundation without streaks or issues. It did not dry sticky and I was also able to apply after my moisturizer, argon oil, and tiger glass camp drops. I’ve worn it all day with only powder foundation and received several compliments that my skin looked fresh.

I have combination skin, so my oily T-zone really doesn’t need any extra help looking “dewy” by midday. So I most likely won’t be using this product as intended – by mixing with foundation or moisturizer – but rather on cheekbones, brow bones, perhaps Cupid’s bow. Probably not inner eyes, harder to place neatly without a brush... As you can see from the photo, this highlighter has no glitter or shimmer particles, but rather a “wet” shine, so it looks very natural and not overdone. That part I do enjoy. Finally, DAO is 18M, so you’ll have a year and a half to use it up.
reviews.review_title: Best suited for dry skin types

reviews.review_text: No shimmer. No glitter (which I love). Just pure dewy glow. I ended up returning the J. Lo. Highlighter and got this one instead.  I mix this in with my Fenty spf moisturizer and apply all over my face. Then i add a little extra to the apples of my cheeks for perfectly sun kissed skin. I will definitely buy more when this bottle runs out.
reviews.review_title: NO SHIMMER. NO GLITTER. JUST GLOW BABY

reviews.review_text: I received this as a gift from Sephora. Very pleasant to use; it spreads easily.  It has a light rose scent that dissipates quickly after application.  I prefer to use it as a highlighter since it lightened my foundation when I mixed it.  3 starts because it has a lot of visible sparkles in the daylight.

I am thrilled with Saie's Glowy Super Gel Lightweight Dewy Highlighter in Starglow (universal champagne). I love the gel-based texture. It's multi-use, in that you can blend it with foundation, lotion, or even put it on top of your makeup. It has rose hip seed oil and glycerin which helps add some moisture into foundation. I have experienced no breakouts from using it, and it adds such a nice glowy finish to my makeup in a natural way. I appreciate the clean ingredients list as well. I will definitely be repurchasing.

I really like this dewy highlighter especially when I mix it in with my foundation. As someone with dry skin it does give me that glass skin/lit from within look. With mix in gel/cream highlighters I'm always concerned that it will be either too dark or glittery for me. This is not the case with this gel as it looks great on my fair skin (the below pic is just the product alone). It also has a very green smell (think Chanel Chance) that I happen to love, but in the beginning it is a bit strong. It does dissipate with time, but if you're sensitive to scents this might not work for you.
Gives you the perfect all over glow! It’s so versatile and easy to use. I like to mix it with my foundation between my fingers then apply.

I was THRILLED to get this to review as it was on my list!! This is an ultra sheer lightweight your skin-but better, formula. It has a very subtle natural honey scent that isn’t offensive -it’s just a hint. I love it and I’m sensitive, no issues. It comes out almost watery sheer instead of more thick like CT Hollywood Flawless Filter which has more coverage like a light foundation and more tint shades. The Starglow shade I’m reviewing is translucent. You won’t see a tint on your skin. All you will see is a very natural looking dewy-wet healthy glow. No sparkles, no texture. Truly natural! It dries down moisturizing not greasy or chalky. I put it under and over my foundation and powder. No issues. On the high points of my face (cheek bones etc) it gave me thee most natural looking highlight I’ve ever had. Honestly. I was initially a little worried about the watery sheerness thinking it wouldn’t show up or wreck my makeup, boy was I wrong! This is truly natural for a no makeup look. You get a ton at 30ml (foundation and CT HFF size) so this should last forever. It has a blurring and glowy effect on my chest. And compared to Josie Maran Argan Illuminizer which is more shimmery and solid, again this is far more natural looking and goof-proof. Being a clean ingredient makeup I think this is a solid win and if you are struggling with applying a more natural looking non powder or non thick dewy glow that hydrates which is great for drier skin or the over 40 crowd like me who is drying more and needing more of a dewy glow that doesn’t feel or look like a mask or take forever to blend this is great. I love CT HFF but this is great over powder or liquid foundation whereas CT HFF is a stand alone for coverage. This one won’t give you coverage but won’t be thick over any foundation which is a win in my opinion. My chest looks flawless as this doesn’t apply streaky if you just want to quickly apply it and blend it in. CT is at the top then Saie then Josie Maran for comparison.

Saie got it right when they marketed this as glowy, lightweight, dewy and super!  It ticks all the boxes!  

I received this product as gratis from Sephora, and was impressed with the quality and performance.  To begin with, I like how lightweight this feels.  I was able to put it on and then forget about it because it felt like nothing at all - which is how I like my makeup to feel.  As for its effectiveness, it provided highlight in a natural way.  I felt like it reflected the light, rather than being on a high beam.  I enjoyed using this above the brow for a little lift, or below the brow for a little light.  I can also see wearing this in the warmer months on the cheekbone.  If you want a more dramatic look, you could build this.  In my pic, I swiped a thick swatch so you could really see the product.

As for this being "clean," I think the packaging in very unique.  I do like products that are free from irritants, but I also really like products that can be recycled.  Be sure to check out the sidebar pic on the product page about how to recycle this.  Such an inspiration!
reviews.review_title: It really is glowy, dewy, lightweight - and super!

reviews.review_text: I received this product as a free sample but I was already a fan of the original Starglow formula. The bronze shade is great for warming up lighter skin tones.  Works beautifully alone or mixed with other products.

A beautiful lightweight product with a unique cooling gel texture that can be used as a primer or as a highlighter on top of foundation. Leaves a beautiful and glass-like glow that lasts all day. Can be also mixed with foundation or moisturizer for a more subtle finish.
reviews.review_title: Best product for a natural glow

reviews.review_text: Didn't last the day, good for about 1 hour. Returning this product as it doesn't work over my makeup

I received this free for testing purposes m, and I love it.  It gives just the right amount of glow to make you look healthy without looking greasy.  I like to mix this with my foundation for a luminous beautiful finish.  Absolutely stunning!

I received this product from Sephora for an honest review
I definitely liked this product it wore nicely all day and gave me a dewy glow. I tapped it on over my foundation and it did not disrupt it at all. I like that is is so light weight and natural looking. It caused me no break outs either which is a plus.

On facetime the other day my girlfriend said, "WHAT MAKEUP ARE YOU WEARING? YOU'RE GLOWING!"
That sums it up - you'll love this product :)

I love the texture of this highlighter! It is definitely like a gel that melt into the skin. Makes my skin feel fresh and leaves it looking plump and hydrated. It gives my skin a luminescent glow. I used it as a primer on top of sunscreen and had no issues. I also used it as a highlighter on top of foundation, tapped it on with my finger then used a sponge to absorb the excess.  It gives a natural, fresh , plump kind of glow. My dry skin loves it and now I want the sun glow shade!
LOVE THIS STUFF!!! perfect to put on right after moisturizer if you want a naked glow or to add makeup on top for a perfect underglow. highly recommended and you cant beat the price
Effortless glow in a bottle. A must have. Layer it under or over foundation.

This product is so beautiful. It gives a great lit from within look. I’ve worn it all over my face under my tinted moisturizer and I’ve worn it on top on my high points on my face. It works well both ways. It’s perfect for that no makeup look.

Really enjoy using this product. It is light weight and has a pleasant smell that isn't overwhelming. It gives a warm glow and shimmer just as expected but does not feel heavy. It is also easy to remove at the end of the day. I do recommend this!

I love this product. This is created the most natural highlight I’ve ever seen. It is very light and so versatile. It’s great on your eyes as well as your cheeks. It will be great in the summer on your décolletage. I like to mix it with my cream eyeshadows for a very light and fresh look
This product is so amazing! It has such a subtle but pretty glow to it. I’ve added it to my foundation and I’ve also put it on top. Either way, the glow comes through and looks amazing on the skin.

I am very impressed with this luminizer. It provides a very fresh look either over or under powder. It’s very creamy feeling and it suitable for dry skin and is not overly shimmery making it great for day looks as well. It plays well with other makeup products and does not move around a ton 

The packaging is nice and is recycle as well which is great

EVERYBODY AND THEIR MOTHERS NEED THIS. I can’t speak more highly of this. I have the driest skin. It’s dull and lifeless and lacks luster. But this!!!! Omg it’s a godsend and Everyone needs to go out and buy this. This can function as a dewy primer, an all over highlighter, something to mix in your foundation, or a highlight for the tops of the face. It would also be BEAUTIFUL on the body in the summer time. If you are an ingredient junkie like myself, you may be happy to know this has good ingredients for the skin and no silicones! You better believe I’m gonna DRENCH myself in this when the sun comes out. It’s gorgeous. It leaves the skin luminous and beautiful, with no glitter at all. My skin looks healthy and glows and I only wish I could take my mask off in public so everyone could see my skin. And Don’t even get me started on the scent!! It’s like smelling a fresh bouquet of ROSES. I am in love. Sorry for my rant, but I will forever need this product in my makeup routine because it is a game-changer.

I tried this both under my foundation and as a highlight on my cheekbone, and it worked well both ways. It was really easy to use both ways and I didn’t have any issues with pilling. I normally prefer matte skin but this was so pretty and easy I can see myself using it often

I’ve never heard about this brand before but I’m happy that Sephora introduced me to it. For such low price, you are getting a real good product. So I have only full coverage foundations and if I wanna go for a lighter coverage, I just mix this luminizer with my foundation and I’m getting more natural dewy look. You can also wear it alone if you want to achieve a fresher look. Def will repurchase it

I absolutely adore this product and how easy it is to use and incorporate into my everyday looks! It has a very lightweight fluid texture that beautifully highlights the high points of my face that I want to catch the light. I love that I can also mix it in with my facial cream or foundation to create an all over glow for a freshly, dewy looking complexion. It’s such a fun concept that is perfect for anyone trying to achieve a glowy look. 
I received this product from Sephora to test.
reviews.review_title: Perfect for a dewy complexion & natural highlights

reviews.review_text: I received this as a gift from Saie beauty. I love the dewy finish this product gives me! I will say it does have a very natural scent to it that tends to linger. Love the product and the gentle formula!

WOW! This highlighter checked off boxes I didn't even know existed. The instructions suggest mixing it with other products but I opted to dispense a little and smooth over clean skin. The result? An instant, natural glow! I didn't even feel like I needed to add any makeup after applying it. The few times I did apply makeup over it I was extremely impressed with how solid of a "base" it provided. I would almost label this as a primer/highlighter.

This product is great! I tried "FuturDrew" by glossier and this is hands down, WAY better! It has a gel like, light texture, as opposed to FuturDrew's oily and heavy texture. Also, this highlighter has pearlescent particles, which helps hydrates the skin and enhance it looks.

It gives you a subtle glow, without looking greasy or to shiny and gives a healthy look to your skin. It is easy to apply and easy to blend into the skin, whatever colour you choose.

I tried mixing it with my foundation, like they suggested, but it ending up decreasing my coverage. I prefer to wear this alone. With a foundation, I find it makes my skin too oily.

First of all, the amount of product/size of the bottle is definitely larger than I expected!  This is going to last a loooong time.  I have the shade "Starglow" and it suits my fair skintone perfectly since it's a very light pearly champagne color.  The formula itself is quite liquidy; I think that I was expecting something similar to the Charlotte Tilbury Flawless Filter but the consistency is actually much thinner and less opaque.  This can function as a more "natural" highlight but I'm actually enjoying using it as a foundation mixer more since it adds a subtle luminosity without looking actually shiny or metallic.  I like the pump top on it as well because it makes dispensing the product easy.  The product really is a good value for the money and I'm absolutely going to enjoy using it.

Love this highlighter! It gives the skin that nice healthy glow without looking too glittery. The formula is gel-like with very fine pearlescent particles to help enhance the look of skin while it hydrates. I have used it mixed in with my sample of Dior’s face and body foundation in 2N that I find was a little too runny, and the combo works very well and applies without pilling with a brush. 
I would definitely rate this over GlamGlow’s Glowstarter highlighting moisturizer, as that one is thicker, harder to mix with other products and can pill if not careful with the amount of product used. Saie’s highlighter I find to be much more user-friendly and harder to have your finished look become a disco-ball. I am going to enjoy using this product and definitely would repurchase as part of my stash for my base-face!
reviews.review_title: Perfect to mix with runnier foundations.

reviews.review_text: I was skeptical about the color / shade on my fair skin, but found that I love the effect. Whether bare or with foundation, this provides me with a subtle healthy glow without looking like bronzer or being difficult to blend so I don't look painted. It adds a soft warmth rather than an all out bronze, although it is buildable for a more pronounced color, which I will likely do to enhance a summer sun kissed look. I particularly love that it doesn't look yellow / orange or pink / red as most bronze tinted products do - this is a genuinely neutral tint. I have the Starlight shade and didn't see any need for this but there is definitely a difference and they both provide an amazing lift to my skin, especially for photos where the glow makes my skin look positively radiant.
reviews.review_title: A surprisingly awesome product for my fair skin

reviews.review_text:
Starglow is a beautifully luminous, dewy dumpling skin highlighter.

It has a smooth, gel-like texture with a gorgeous pearly sheen but not any harsh sparkle or glitter. Mixed into a base (whether moisturizer or foundation) it gives the skin a subtle lit from within glow. Tapped on top of makeup as a liquid highlighter, it gives an effortless wet look finish.

My only complaint (as an oily skinned girl) is that by midday I was less dewy and radiant and more borderline greasy looking but the colour and sheen of this is top notch. The bottle is also huge so it will last a long time.
reviews.review_title: Like A Smooth and Dewy Dumpling

reviews.review_text: This stuff is amazing! I was wary that it would be too shimmery and I'd look like a 14 year old disco queen wannabe, but it genuinely gave me the kind of glow that made me look dewy, healthy and radiant! It presents beautifully in photos on either bare skin or applied over foundation, giving me an even more natural and subtle luminosity. It could not be easier to use, whether you choose to apply with your fingers or a brush - it melts into skin (or foundation) easily and due to the subtlety of it, it's hard to find a margin where it obviously ends. Definitely buildable if you want a more obvious / less natural finish but at 48 and especially with the dullness that dry, winter weather brings I am all about the way it makes my skin look simply healthy.
reviews.review_title: A staple in my kit from now on

reviews.review_text: This highlighter gives such a pretty dewy glow! It can be used several ways but the best for me was mixed with moisturizer. I didn’t like the way it looked when mixed with foundation. It is easy to apply, it doesn’t pill, and it absorbs quickly and doesn’t feel sticky. I did receive this from gratis from Sephora for my honest review.

Love this highlighter! It’s not glittery, but instead smooth and luminous. I really appreciate that it is mostly made of water for my super dry skin. A little goes a long way, Would totally recommend!

Cons: if you are sensitive to scent, this might not be for you. Pros: I love the scent. There is a noticeable floral scent that disappears a min or so after application. I use this under my foundation and it truely gives me glow within. It’s also lightweight and comfortable to wear. This reminds me of Charlotte Tilburry Hollywood filter shade 2 and Tom Ford Spin Spin sugar I own. The other 2 are more pigmented and thicker consistency. For under foundation I prefer Saie since it looks more natural. The other 2 are great also but I have to be careful with application. You get a whole lot of products for the price. Bravo Saie for a beautiful product at a great price. Picture include: top to bottom: Saie Starglow, Tom Ford Spin Spin Sugar, Charlotte Tilburry Hollywood Filter shade 2

This product is GORGEOUS and the amount of product you get for the price is crazy. It gives a beautiful glow from within. Theres no shimmer or glitter that enhances texture. It applies well over powder and also looks great applied under products. Very versatile and gorgeous

I have both shades of this and absolutely adore it! I use the lighter tone as a starter base after skincare, then the darker shade as a pseudo bronzer... wears well all day and incredibly flattering. Must buy!

This is the first product I’ve tried from this brand and I got to say I am shocked! I am so in love with this lightweight gel highlighter! I love using this as a primer and mixing it in with my foundation! It adds just the right amount of shine without changing the foundation formula or making it greasy. The glitter is very fine so you really do get that natural glow from within look. The price is right for the 1 fl oz of product you get! All you need is 1 pump and it gets the job done! I would try this out if you are looking for a lightweight, comfortable, and glowy primer / mixing product!

This probably works best if you don't wear other makeup with it. It looked pretty good when I tried it on the back of my hand (although it did seem to emphasize texture), a little bit glowy, a little sparkly, and added some warmth. But it didn't work well on top of or mixed into my makeup, it sort of just disappeared. And using it as a primer didn't really work either because it wasn't noticeable under my foundation. Since I always wear foundation when I put on makeup, this really isn't a product I have a use for.

PROS: This lightweight, watery gel gives the gentlest whisper of dewy-skin. It blends with various foundations easily, and applies on its own without leaving residual tack. This includes my water based (YSL All Hours & Sephora Clean Glowing Skin) and silicone based (Giorgio Armani Luminous Silk). I am a fan of Glossier’s Futuredew, which lists water as its first ingredient, but is most definitely an oily serum, and does not set. Star Glow, on the other hand, imparts a soft, slightly cool-toned brightening effect to the skin, without feeling or looking just ‘wet.’ It absorbs quickly, too, and does not interfere with my setting powder application. An advantage of the quick-absorbing formula is that I did not find it transferring to clothes. I found this product to be extremely versatile, even using it on my collarbones for lowlight definition. Bonus: it comes in a mini size!

CONS: That being said - it does dilute coverage. After all-day wear, the areas of hyperpigmentation on my skin were quite visible. If you are concerned with coverage, this might not be the best choice for you. I don’t mind it - I just didn’t expect it. 

Final Thoughts: I can see myself finishing this bottle, and trying out another hue. It is an understated alternative to the high-shine glassy look, easily transitioning between, and wearable both day and night.
reviews.review_title: An all-around soft glow for any skin type

reviews.review_text: I have very compromised skin atm due to maskne. This product made me fall in love with my skin all over again! It adds such a beautiful glow! I love applying it under my foundation or use it as a subtle highlight on my nose and cheeks.

It is as lightweight as it says. It works great under foundation, mixed in and on top. Doesn’t mess with my skincare or complexion products. I’ve been using it as a primer and mixed in with my ilia foundation. I’m combination and my t zone didn’t look oily at the end of the day which is huge for me.  Overall I’m happy with this product and it’s clean which is huge plus for me!!

I have very sensitive skin, and I am always cautious of what products I mix with so that it prevents any sort of irritation on my face. I LOVE how the ingredients list helps to not only boost radiance and glow from within, but it makes sure to protect my skin from harsh environmental aggressors. This dewy highlighter can be used in any way you wish. I use it to mix my powder blushes and eyeshadows to creat a new creamy texture that is more easy to apply. Cannot recommend this product enough, and for the price, it is definitely worth ever penny!!

i received this to try and review for Sephora, and initally wasn't exactly sure how to use it, but the very same day @graceatwood (The Stripe) shared her own how to use and review! Long story short, this is not a highlighter -- instead, it gives you a much more subtle "healthy glow" and feels like it walks the line between makeup and skincare, since it add glow, but also has Vitamin C and Hyaluronic Acid in it. The Starglow color was pretty sheer in my opinion, and would work well on a variety of skin tones. 

The best way i can describe this is that it's like an IRL instagram filter. I've experimented with this a few different ways now, and I find that i like using it best as a primer either alone for a no-makeup look, or under makeup for a gorgeous 'lit from within' glow. It's very easy to apply and is glowy without being glittery or shimmery. Its subtle for sure, and is not strobe-like (which is how i think about a true highlighter, which i would NOT put all over my face!) . It smells wonderful (maybe slightly floral, but it dissipates quickly) and isn't heavy at all, and the price is so good for a clean beauty product. 10/10 would buy again, and i'd love to try the more bronze version as well for comparison. Looking forward to taking it on a future vacation for an all-over body glow as well!
Wow! Even without foundation, my skin is GLOWING. Provides a subtle yet noticeable healthy dew. Great minimalist makeup! Smells pleasant, and formula absorbs easily. *Photo is untouched

I absolutely LOVE this product. I use it a few different ways — on a no makeup day it's perfect over or mixed with tinted moisturizer (or slip cover!) for a subtle glow. I also use it as a highlighter as the last step after bronzer/blush. It feels so moisturizing and plumping on my skin it's like a drink for my face! My favorite color is actually the bronze one Sunglow — I'm pretty fair and it gives the most natural wash of sun kissed color. I've been forgoing my powder bronzer for this except for some light contouring with a more dramatic makeup look! As others have mentioned it's a generous size and the pump works great. Suffice it to say will be repurchasing often.

The "lit from within" glow when using this highlighter is amazing. I have sensitive skin and stay away from glitter and heavy products. After multiple uses of this product, I didn't get any irritation or breakouts. It feels light and cool on the skin when you apply it. It glides and blends effortlessly. Feels like nothing on, yet gives such a dewy and luminous finish. Bonus that it has goodness like rose hip seed oil and vitamin C.

Overall I like this product although not as a highlighter. It looks great on a bare face without any additional makeup. It gives a really nice dewy glow to the face without looking like you are wearing any makeup, which could be quite perfect as I typically do not wear makeup day to day.

I’ve tried to use this as a highlighter and also mixed into my foundation. As a highlighter I think it’s just too subtle. And I think it changes the texture of my base products too much for me to want to mix it with my foundation. 

My biggest gripe with this product is the smell. I’m not a huge fan fragranced products but typically don’t mind it if I like the product - but the smell of this is very strong and almost like rotten flowers. I’m not sure if it’s just how the particular fragrance reacting specifically to my skin but the product is a no go for me due to how bad smells. I am still rating it four stars as I think it’s overall a lovely product that I would use otherwise, and could be good for somebody who enjoys the scent.
reviews.review_title: nice glow for no makeup days
